hook.text: Sodium, potassium, and magnesium keep muscles firing. Lose too much in sweat and cramps follow.

buildup.text: Electrolytes conduct electrical signals between nerves and muscles. Without them, contraction fails.

discovery.text: Some athletes lose 3,000 mg of sodium per hour through sweatâ€”far more than water alone replaces.

twist.text: Most sports drinks have too little sodium for heavy sweaters. Salty foods often work better.

climax.text: Electrolyte needs vary individually. Salty sweaters need sodium replacement; others just need water.

punchline.text: Not everyone needs electrolytes. Know your own sweat.

quiz.question: How much sodium can some athletes lose per hour?
